intro: Reseda pampaniniana, commonly known as the Andean mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Reseda pampaniniana is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates.
